result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic A Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

Probation may be transferred to Dane county.
Consecutive to: the sentence he is serving.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

No contact with victim or co-actors listed in complaint.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered with attached
Voter Ineligibility Notice and acknowledgment.

Defendant Dominic A Berry in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days ) consecutive to any other sentence
3 Years of Initial Confinement
1 Years of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 2 Years consecutive to the sentence he is serving. Probation may be transferred to Dane County. 
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with victim or co-actors listed in complaint.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Seek employment;
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Condition Time: 30 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS -  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
